Hunter Greene will start for the Reds. This year Greene is 9-4 with a 2.83 ERA in 24 starts.
Paul Skenes will start for the Pirates. So far Skenes is 10-3 with a 2.07 ERA in the first 21 starts of his career.
Andrew McCutchen and the Pittsburgh Pirates take the field on Sunday at Great American Ball Park against Hunter Greene, who is starting for the Cincinnati Reds.
The Pittsburgh Pirates and the Cincinnati Reds meet Sunday in MLB action from Great American Ball Park.
The Reds have an 8.7 K/9 this season as a pitching staff, which ranks 11th in the majors.
The Pirates have the 21st-ranked team ERA among all MLB pitching staffs (4.20).
Pirates are the favorites with odds of -122, while the Reds are the underdogs with odds of +102.
The Pirates lost the first three games against the St. Louis Cardinals before a 3-2 win Thursday.
The Reds played the Atlanta Braves in their last set, winning 6-5 in the first game before a pair of losses to drop the series.
This will be the final installment in a three-game series.
The over/under for the game is set at 8.
First pitch will be at 1:10 p.m. ET.
